wikipedia_page.main: Sir Arthur Cecil Tyrrell Beck (3 December 1876 – 22 March 1932) was a British Liberal Party politician.

link_mentions.page: List of United Kingdom MPs: B
List of MPs elected in the 1918 United Kingdom general election

response: Several Members of Parliament joined the group, including Bottomley, Cecil Beck, Christopher Lowther, Claude Lowther,F. W. S. Craig, Minor Parties at British Parliamentary Elections Charles Frederick Palmer and Sir C. V. F. Townshend.  It also sponsored several candidates; John Nicholson accepted its support, but after winning the 1921 Westminster Abbey by-election, did not join the group.  Murray Sueter, who was co-sponsored by the group and by the Anti-Waste League, was elected in the 1921 Hertford by-election.

link_mentions.page: List of Lords Commissioners of the Treasury

response: The by-election was caused by the resignation of the sitting Liberal MP, Cecil Beck. Beck had been appointed a Lord Commissioner of the Treasury, one of the formal titles held by government WhipsThe Times, 4 February 1915 p8  and under the Parliamentary rules of the day had to resign and fight a by-election.
